body:
I tried to reproduce the problem with doccano v1.8.0 but it can't.

Can you show me some network tab information?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6737785/180677625-0167c514-ef60-476c-aa3c-74f3b6c91ad1.png)

```

```
âžœ doccano task

Thanks. It looks Post request to `/v1/projects` is tried.

Can you give me the detailed information about the post request by using developer tools?
In the case of Chrome, open developer tools by Command+Option+J(Control+Shift+J in windows), move to the network tab, try to create the project in doccano, and select `projects` like the below image.
- https://developer.chrome.com/docs/devtools/shortcuts/

![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6737785/180677625-0167c514-ef60-476c-aa3c-74f3b6c91ad1.png)
Got it! Below is the screenshot of `projects` under the `Network` tab. It seems that there is a `500` error. This is the rest of the log:

Thanks. It looks the request has no problem.

Hmm

I tried chrome, and the private and incognito modes in both firefox and chrome but nothing happens. I also tried not being in a venv, and just on the global env of my machine, also the same thing.

I'm not sure what else to try ðŸ˜¢

Maybe some initialization does not work correctly. I think you should not be able to create a project by the admin page: - go to `localhost:8000/admin/` - Select `Sequence labeling projects` - Select `Add sequence labeling project` button - Fill out the form and select `save` button Another method is to use Docker: - https://github.com/doccano/doccano#docker

Ok, so this is interesting. I was indeed trying to create projects using the `admin` account.
I went to `localhost:8000/admin/`, and then under `Sequence labeling projects` I found ALL the projects that I could not create. So then I decided to create a user account and after clicking on `SAVE` the page died and could not go back to `localhost:8000/admin/`, it now gives me a `404` error.
nvm, I can still access `localhost:8000/admin/`. I'm now trying to delete those projects from the admin page.

I successfully created another user and when I tried to create a project using the other user nothing happened, but I can see it in the `localhost:8000/admin/` page under projects.
When I try to delete all the projects or any project, it gives me a `500` error, and nothing is deleted.

Summary

- If you create a project on the project creation page, `500` error occurred
- If you see the projects on the admin page, there are all projects
- If you try to create a user on the admin page, `404` error occurred
- If you try to delete the projects on the (admin page or doccano's project list page?), `500` error occurred

Sorry @Hironsan for the confusion:


> If you create a project on the project creation page, `500` error occurred

No. If I'm on the normal project creation page nothing happens. But if I'm within `localhost:8000/admin/` I can create a project with no issues.

> If you see the projects on the admin page, there are all projects

Yes.

> If you try to create a user on the admin page, `404` error occurred

No, I got the `404` when I forgot the last `/` in `localhost:8000/admin/`

> If you try to delete the projects on the (admin page or doccano's project list page?), `500` error occurred

Yes, from the admin page. I can't see any project on doccano's page.

Thanks for fixing my text.

> No, I got the 404 when I forgot the last / in localhost:8000/admin/

This is normal behavior. So this is not related to this issue.

I tried with docker and it works fine.

But I'd really like for it to work without docker and get the issue fixed. :)

> But I'd really like for it to work without docker and get the issue fixed. :)

I think so. I found I need to improve logging to find where is the problem.

Anyway, thank you for reporting the issue.

issue.title: Can't create sequence labeling project : WARNING:django.request:Forbidden: /v1/projects

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body: When I create sequence labeling project > click Create. No response. **Snap shot of command prompt console** ``` C:\Users\sin-yee.teoh>doccano webserver --port 8000 Starting server with port 8000. Forbidden: /v1/projects WARNING:django.request:Forbidden: /v1/projects ``` Your Environment --------- * Operating System: Windows 10 * Python Version Used: 3.10 * When you install doccano: Last week

body:
I could reproduce the problem.
This problem seems to occur in some environments (For me, my M1 MacBook pro). I tried to reproduce the problem in another MacBook pro and Ubuntu, but it couldn't.

I investigated the differences between the SQLite3 version, but it's not related.

Stack trace:

```bash
django.db.utils.OperationalError: no such table: main.api_project
```
Interesting! Because my machine is Intel MacBook pro. I could try it again once I upgrade BigSur to the newest macOS.

This issue is related to the CORS headers, @slkh . It works if you'll add your domain name in .env file, for example, doccano.org:
`CSRF_TRUSTED_ORIGINS=doccano.org`
and expose this variable in the backend specification located in docker-compose.prod.yml:
```
    environment:
      CSRF_TRUSTED_ORIGINS: "${CSRF_TRUSTED_ORIGINS}"
```

issue.title: Can not re-install doccano

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
Question:
How to re-install the doccano by using a new .env file including different administrator account and password than before

Steps:
1. Install doccano by using docker method successfully, but when try to create a project by click the "Create" button, it did not work.
2. remove the docker image with the command 'sudo docker rm -v doccano'
3. Try to install doccano by using docker-compose method suggested in other topic to resolve the problem.
4. Forget the administrator password a few days later
5. stop and remove the container
6. re-install the doccano by using docker-compose mentioned in Readme and get the following error:
docker-postgres-1  | 2022-11-19 21:03:36.300 UTC [37] FATAL:  password authentication failed for user "admin"
docker-postgres-1  | 2022-11-19 21:03:36.300 UTC [37] DETAIL:  Password does not match for user "admin".

7. Try to find and delete the docker volumes with the prefix name 'doccano', such as 'doccano_node_modules'. But there is no volume named with the prefix name 'doccano', most of them are named as random character as following:
DRIVER              VOLUME NAME
local               0de642ca5127459209644bb67f2e8298d03753c9a00c34e030e1e52e4c199485
local               0e3b80126a365b3427777e044f2763c7fd8b7b88e3bb90f2c9aab27696e44671
local               1a32e9d9a47cd5f379e45f09c8526b9aef095bfc335476c692f546b35835648a

Ask for help:
1. How to remove the volumes with only random character created by doccano docker-compose 
2. How can I re-install the doccano with the new .env file by using docker-compose method

issue.title: Enable to set CSRF_TRUSTED_ORIGINS in debug mode

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.
